intro: Chirita hedyotidea, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has opposite, heart-shaped leaves. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural use.
